page.title: 05Parkstone Golf Course cont.
page.content: In the dry summers the golf course dries up and so sprinklers have been installed that can come out of the ground at the touch of a button and spray water at great distances. The water supply comes from the two lakes. Vandalism was a problem. Vandels dug and gouged the course with gardening tools. They also pull up the putting flags and break them. They damaged the fire beaters. They have small bridges made of logs which are laid down long ways over little riverlets but when they have a flood the water lifts the logs and they float away down river.
